intro: Orobus saxatilis, commonly known as the rock scabious, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly habitats, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are narrow and often covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. Orobus saxatilis is known for its resilience to harsh environmental conditions, making it a common sight in alpine and coastal regions.
